intro: Sebastiania alpina, commonly known as the Alpine Sebastiania, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Andes. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its unique, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, temperate climates. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often covered in a fine, white waxy coating. The flowers are small and inconspicuous, but the plant is notable for its ornamental value and adaptability to harsh environments.
